name: UpdateSecretScanningAlertStatus
description:
Update the status of a secret scanning alert on GitHub.

Use this tool to update the status of a secret scanning alert in a GitHub repository. Requires admin access and a personal access token with the `repo`, `security_events`, or `public_repo` scopes, or a GitHub App with `secret_scanning_alerts` write permission.

parameters.name: repository_owner
parameters.description: The GitHub username or organization name that owns the repository. It is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repository_name
parameters.description: The name of the repository. Not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: alert_identifier
parameters.description: The unique number identifying the secret scanning alert. Found in the alert URL or the response of `GET /repos/{owner}/{repo}/code-scanning/alerts`.

value_schema.description: The number that identifies an alert. You can find this at the end of the URL for a code scanning alert within GitHub, and in the `number` field in the response from the `GET /repos/{owner}/{repo}/code-scanning/alerts` operation.

parameters.name: alert_state
parameters.description: Set the state of the secret scanning alert to 'open' or 'resolved'. 'Resolution' is required if set to 'resolved'.

value_schema.description: Sets the state of the secret scanning alert. You must provide `resolution` when you set the state to `resolved`.

parameters.name: resolution_reason_for_secret_scanning_alert
parameters.description: Specifies the reason for resolving the alert when the state is set to 'resolved'. Possible values: 'None', 'false_positive', 'wont_fix', 'revoked', 'used_in_tests'.

value_schema.description: **Required when the `state` is `resolved`.** The reason for resolving the alert.

parameters.name: alert_resolution_comment
parameters.description: An optional comment when closing an alert. Set to `null` if changing the alert state to `open`. Cannot be updated or deleted.

value_schema.description: An optional comment when closing an alert. Cannot be updated or deleted. Must be `null` when changing `state` to `open`.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the GitHub API.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repo
parameters.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: alert_number
parameters.description: The number that identifies an alert. You can find this at the end of the URL for a code scanning alert within GitHub, and in the `number` field in the response from the `GET /repos/{owner}/{repo}/code-scanning/alerts` operation.

value_schema.description: The number that identifies an alert. You can find this at the end of the URL for a code scanning alert within GitHub, and in the `number` field in the response from the `GET /repos/{owner}/{repo}/code-scanning/alerts` operation.

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: **Required when the `state` is `resolved`.** The reason for resolving the alert.

value_schema.description: **Required when the `state` is `resolved`.** The reason for resolving the alert.

parameters.name: resolution_comment
parameters.description: An optional comment when closing an alert. Cannot be updated or deleted. Must be `null` when changing `state` to `open`.

value_schema.description: An optional comment when closing an alert. Cannot be updated or deleted. Must be `null` when changing `state` to `open`.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Sets the state of the secret scanning alert. You must provide `resolution` when you set the state to `resolved`.

value_schema.description: Sets the state of the secret scanning alert. You must provide `resolution` when you set the state to `resolved`.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
